reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Improving sexual and reproductive health and rights and biodiversity conservation through integrated approach

description.narrative: The development problem of the proposed project is limited access to SRHR combined with unsustainable use of natural resources. The purpose of the project is to improve SRHR and biodiversity conservation through integrated approach. The project focuses on peoples empowerment capacity building and awareness raising improving livelihood and well-being as well as strengthening partnerships to promote an integrated approach. Capacity building and awareness raising activities will be targeted towards young peopl e and Natural Resource Management communities. Through the trainings it is expected that their understanding of the issues and motivation to promote sustainable development and SRHR are increased. The long-term development objective for the integrated Popu lation Health and Environment (PHE) initiative is Healthy and productive communities where young people can live in harmony with nature and realize their SRHR. This project is a continuation project and forms a third phase of a collaborative PHE project wh ich is implemented through an integrated approach with four partners: Vaestoliitto (the Family Federation of Finland) FPAN (the Family Planning Association of Nepal) WWF Finland and WWF Nepal. Cooperation between these partners started already in 2011 and this project builds upon the lessons learned from the first two phases of the project. The project will be directly linked to the PHE initiative of WWF Nepal and WWF Finland supported by the MFA. These two projects will complement each other and there will be close partnership and coordination with WWF Nepal at the central and field levels.Capacity building and awareness raising activities will be targeted towards young people and Natural Resource Management (NRM) communities.
